contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Chinese |title = Koufu |float = |collapse = No |c = 口父 |t = <!-- Traditional --> |s = <!-- Simplified --> |l = <!-- Literal Meaning --> |p = Kǒufù |mi = Kʰɔufu }} {{Chinese text}} {{Portal|China}} '''Koufu''' (口父; ''Kǒufù'') was an [[History of China|ancient Chinese]] nobleman, a [[Zhou Dynasty|Zhou]] leader honoured by the [[Shang dynasty|Shang]] king [[Wu Yi (ruler)|Wǔ Yǐ]]. His [[Chinese name|name]] means “Mouth parent”.<ref>[http://characters.cultural-china.com/37.html The Chinese Character, an Interpretable Chinese Culture]</ref> Wǔ Yǐ rewarded Koufu with a city called [[Qishan County|Qiyi]] (岐邑).<ref>''[[Bamboo Annals]]''</ref><ref>Historically, the site was also known as Qishan (岐山).</ref> Koufu died in the 21st year of the reign of Wǔ Yǐ. == Notes == <references/> [[Category:12th-century BC rulers]] [[Category:Shang Dynasty politicians]] [[Category:Chinese nobility]]
